children.value: An example three tier application architecture you can build and have deployed in IBM Kubernetes service or IBM Red Hat OpenShift in less than an hour using the IBM Garage for Cloud Developer Tools and Starter Kit Templates.
Part 2 of the guide is a follow on from Part 2 and will concentrate on building out the following areas :
database and populating it with data
Add a Cloudant backend to the service
Update the gradle config to include cloudant dependencies
Add CloudantConfig to hold the url, username, password, and databaseName values
Implement logic to load the configuration from the secret binding or local file
Log into cloud.ibm.com and open the Cloudant service from the resource list
Click on service credentials and expand the listed credentials
Copy the json contents from the credentials into
Add a CloudantApi component to create the CloudantClient instance from the configuration
Add the values to the helm chart
The cloudantBinding value should match the name of the cloudant binding secret
file in the chart to set
and to set the value for the AppId binding secret

...
appidBinding: "binding-sms-test-oc-appid"

ingress:
  enabled: true
  appid:
    enabled: true
    # web or app - https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/services/appid?topic=appid-kube-auth
    requestType: web
    ...

When the UI application is available, navigate to the https url. An error page should be displayed that looks like the
following:
The url for the error page will look like the following:
Open the IBM Cloud resource list -
Open the AppId instance to the
You have now completed the Micro App Guide demonstrating the

them to register them in the CI pipeline. The
may include additional setup for populating test data etc.
